summary: Over the 6‑hour window wind speeds were consistently high (mean ≈ 18.4, std ≈ 1.05) with low short‑term variability but occasional peaks up to 43.9. Power stayed close to its mean (≈ 0.962, std ≈ 0.050) despite a persistent negative power residual (≈ -0.115); rotor speed was very stable (std ≈ 0.52) while generator speed showed large variability (std ≈ 56.85). Pitch averaged ≈ 16.35, yaw misalignment ≈ 7.88, temperature ≈ 64.8, and status indicators were non‑normal for the entire period, indicating a sustained anomalous operational state.
